thread.title: ‘Stranger Things’ announces Halloween return during Super Bowl
thread.title_full: ‘Stranger Things’ announces Halloween return during Super Bowl

author: KATE FELDMAN
title: ‘Stranger Things’ announces Halloween return during Super Bowl
text:
SEE IT: ‘Stranger Things’ announces Halloween return during Super Bowl commercial ‘Stranger Things’ announces Halloween return during Super Bowl NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Sunday,  21 PM 
The Super Bowl got a little bit stranger thanks to a surprise Netflix announcement about the return of “Stranger Things.” 
The second season will be released on Halloween, and the 40-second trailer promises all the ‘80s homages you could hope for. 
A fake Eggo ad opens the trailer before Dustin (Gaten Matarazzo), Mike (Finn Wolfhard) and Lucas (Caleb McLaughlin) stand in front of Hawkins Middle School in Ghostbusters uniforms. 
“The world is turning upside down,” “Stranger Things” promises. “Stranger Things” will return to Netflix on Halloween. (Netflix) 
Not much is known about the second season, but Joe Keery (Steve Harrington), Noah Schnapp (Will Byers), Millie Bobby Brown (Eleven), Natalia Dyer (Nancy), Charlie Heaton (Jonathan), Cara Buono (Karen) and Matthew Modine (Dr. Martin Brenner) are all returning. 
Newcomers include Paul Reiser, Sean Astin and Linnea Berthelsen. Tags:
